breakout_item-20000101:
<color=#E4A821>Throwable weapon that deals high explosive damage and ignites enemies within range, causing continuous damage.</color>
A homemade Molotov cocktail filled with liquid fuel. It creates a widespread burning area upon impact, making it a dangerous weapon to both enemies and allies.
breakout_item-20000102:
<color=#E4A821>Restores health to allies within range.</color>
A military-grade medical kit highly favored in the Dark Zone. It contains a more comprehensive selection of medical supplies compared to civilian first-aid kits, making it capable of handling most common injuries in emergency situations.
breakout_item-20000103:
<color=#E4A821>Throwable weapon that stuns and slows enemies within range.</color>
A high-performance, handheld stun grenade designed to weaken the defenses and mobility of enemies caught within its blast radius.
breakout_item-20000104:
<color=#E4A821>Grants a shield to allies within range.</color>
A specially designed stimulant injector containing medication that suppresses pain and temporarily enhances the user's combat capabilities.
breakout_item-20000201: A box of matches that easily absorbs moisture. When they don't sell, striking one grants a fleeting Christmas experience.
breakout_item-20000202: A more reliable fire-starting tool than matches in most cases. Quick, convenient, and resistant to moisture—though occasionally, it might just explode on the spot.
breakout_item-20000203: A small amount of tin-based gunpowder. Its explosive power may not be sufficient for large-scale demolition operations...
breakout_item-20000204: Fuel, whether gas or liquid, is valuable—even the empty cans left behind after use have their resale value.
breakout_item-20000205: A storage tank containing highly flammable and explosive gas. Modifying or repurposing it is strongly discouraged, and under no circumstances should it be used for homemade weapons.
breakout_item-20000206: A metal fuel drum that produces loud clangs when struck—worth more than a plastic fuel container.
breakout_item-20000207: A variety of screws in different sizes, essential for everything from assembling bed frames to building rockets.
breakout_item-20000208: A high-polymer transparent material, commonly known as acrylic. If stray bullets shatter a window, this could serve as a makeshift replacement.
breakout_item-20000209: A bullet-resistant thermoplastic engineered for durability—offering at least a slight boost to personal safety in the Dark Zone.
breakout_item-20000210: High-grade soundproofing panels that effectively reduce noise levels. Some helmets might even have this stuffed inside, making everything sound quieter when worn...
breakout_item-20000211: Impact-resistant hard plastic commonly used for electrical casings. While sturdy, expecting it to stop bullets is a bit of a stretch.
breakout_item-20000212: A high-strength TC4 titanium alloy plate. It could be used for emergency defense against impacts, but selling it is the more cost-effective option.
breakout_item-20000213: Various types of capacitors, commonly used in electrical engineering. Handle with care and follow expert guidance—unless you enjoy the smell of fried circuits.
breakout_item-20000214: A cost-effective data storage solution. Rumor has it that, in another world, some even use it to store combat reports...
breakout_item-20000215: A completely broken mechanical hard drive. If it once contained classified data, at least there's no longer any risk of a leak.
breakout_item-20000216: A solid-state drive with exceptional read and write performance. As a storage device, it's far more valuable than a mechanical hard drive.
breakout_item-20000217: A computer power supply unit. It converts electrical energy for computer use. With a few more essential components, you might just be able to build a PC from scratch.
breakout_item-20000218: A civilian-grade graphics card. Its performance is subjective, but at the very least, it can run Minesweeper smoothly.
breakout_item-20000219: A battery widely used in various portable devices. Not particularly valuable, but for the sake of the environment, proper recycling is recommended.
breakout_item-20000220: A large D cell battery, commonly used in high-power devices. Even if the device itself is completely broken, the battery might still fetch some money.
breakout_item-20000221: A rechargeable high-capacity battery. Useful for many small portable devices. If you get the chance, you should always keep it charged.
breakout_item-20000222: The core component of a solar power system. When the power grid fails, a lot depends on it, but on cloudy days, you're on your own.
breakout_item-20000223: A car battery, a commonly resold item on the market. Not sure if Dolls can use it... Wait, what's a Doll?
breakout_item-20000224: A specialized battery pack with a high price tag. It's said to have excellent battery life, though it's not the easiest to transport.
breakout_item-20000225: A handmade magnet. It has a wide range of uses—though building a homemade maglev train is not one of them.
breakout_item-20000226: A pipe wrench, useful for cutting water pipes. Whether you're helping or causing trouble, as long as there's a pipe, you can get the job done.
breakout_item-20000227: A commonly used multifunctional tool kit. It doesn't contain anything particularly valuable, but it's handy for all sorts of tasks.
breakout_item-20000228: A small hydraulic jack. More reliable than some hastily assembled teammates. You can always trust it to "hold things up for a while."
breakout_item-20000229: A built-in electric hydraulic cutter. Local construction workers use it to cut through steel rebars. These days, a stable construction site isn't easy to come by—everyone values their job.
breakout_item-20000230: A high-strength alloy hydraulic torque wrench. It allows for quick tightening of bolts in tight spaces, securing whatever shelter you have left.
breakout_item-20000231: A standard incandescent light bulb. Cheap to produce, low in efficiency, and a common lighting choice for civilians in many areas.
breakout_item-20000232: A modern energy-saving bulb. Compared to incandescent bulbs, it has better efficiency, a longer lifespan, and a higher market value.
breakout_item-20000233: A waterproof camping lantern. Provides a reliable light source at night. Like solar panels, it's always there to help when the power goes out.
breakout_item-20000234: A more portable lighting device than a camping lantern. Its battery capacity is slightly weaker, but it has a wider range of applications.
breakout_item-20000235: A handheld fill light. Useful for supplementing illumination in low-light environments. Not as convenient as common lamps, but great for photography and evidence collection.
breakout_item-20000236: A popular tactical flashlight. It can instantly illuminate dark corners or temporarily impair enemy movement in combat.
breakout_item-20000237: An intricately crafted pocket watch with a chain. Few people still use these as actual timepieces.
breakout_item-20000238: A commemorative coin. It looks authentic, but in an antique market, it wouldn't fetch much.
breakout_item-20000239: A silver badge with fine engravings. Exquisite craftsmanship, though it falls short of being truly valuable.
breakout_item-20000240: An intricately designed mantel clock. A luxury decoration for the wealthy, but in times of crisis, it's just another piece of furniture too heavy to carry.
breakout_item-20000241: A roughly made gold bracelet. The craftsmanship isn't great, but gold itself is always a solid currency...
breakout_item-20000242: A high-value gold wristwatch. The hands seem a little off, but it's an easy fix—definitely a valuable personal belonging worth taking with you.
breakout_item-20000243: A locally crafted gemstone brooch. Such refined artisanship is a true symbol of luxury in an era dominated by mass-produced goods.
breakout_item-20000244: An extravagant diamond ring. The large, full-cut diamond set on the head guarantees a high price anywhere.
breakout_item-20000245: Imported royal silverware. Perfectly preserved with exquisite craftsmanship—just holding it makes you feel a little like nobility.
breakout_item-20000246: Sourced from the Outes Gold Mine and refined by local artisans. Gold items are valuable, but pure gold ingots are the real prize.
breakout_item-20000247: A vase that looks extremely valuable. Its intricate patterns depict the life of an aristocrat. As beautiful as it is, it's just as fragile.
breakout_item-20000248: A highly valuable golden lion statue. They say it's a real treasure... just because it's solid gold?
breakout_item-20000249: A compact pager. Lacks the complexity of a mobile phone, but its one-way communication is still quite practical.
breakout_item-20000250: A cheap-looking cellphone. It has only the most basic functions.
breakout_item-20000251: A heavy optical device. An older model with a built-in flash, useful for night photography.
breakout_item-20000252: An expensive-looking gold-plated cellphone. Great performance, with the added bonus of valuable decorative materials.
breakout_item-20000253: A new computer model that is all the rage overseas. A symbol of wealth and status—yet when selling off assets, it's always the first thing to go.
breakout_item-20000254: An imported civilian camcorder. A bit outdated but incredibly durable. Camcorders bought from second-hand markets sometimes reveal snippets of unknown happy moments inside.
breakout_item-20000255: A military-grade compass. More reliable than civilian versions, but it still won't give you directions in life.
breakout_item-20000256: A telescope with laser range-finding capability. A useful tool for battlefield observation, though it doesn't do much else.
breakout_item-20000257: A periscope-style optical device. Allows for observation without exposing one's position—offering an extra layer of safety.
breakout_item-20000258: An old radio set. With a bit of learning, you could use it. If luck is on your side, you might intercept some useful intelligence.
breakout_item-20000259: A component of a military laser rangefinder. This module is responsible for laser designation. Keeping it for yourself is unlikely to be useful, but it can fetch a good price.
breakout_item-20000260: A component of a military laser rangefinder. This module is responsible for target positioning. Like the other module, selling it is probably the smarter choice.
breakout_item-20000301:
<color=#E4A821>Increase backpack capacity by +3.</color>
A soldier can only carry so much—having a high-quality backpack is essential for any frontline operative.
